titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stanford University Print Collection SC1039
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig & Jenny Johnson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-03-26 11:45:37 -0700.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.unittitle: Stanford University print collection

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Materials were acquired through varied sources.

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: Access: Materials are open to research use.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford University Print Collection (SC1039). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains lithographs, drawings, watercolor paintings, art prints, diplomas, certificates, printed illustrations, cartoons, advertisements, bird's eye maps, and other printed formats. The main focus is Stanford University and its founders; subjects include the career of Leland Stanford, his racing horses, Stanford University's history, student life, campus buildings, views of campus, faculty achievements, and others. Some items of note include The Leland Stanford Junior University, Plan of Central Premises, 1888, by Shepley, Rutan and Coolidge, architects, and Frederick Law and J. C. Olmsted, landscape architects; original water color designs of mosaics for Memorial Church by A. E. Paoletti; nine demands posted by Students for a Democratic Society on the door of the President's office, concerning the Stanford Research Institute, 1968; original sketches by Leland Stanford, Jr.; Currier and Ives prints of Stanford's race horses; design for the president's house by Louis Christian Mullgardt, architect; woodblock prints by Della Taylor Hoss from Mary Curry Tressider's “Trees of Yosemite," 1932; print by Enrique Chagoya “Illegal Spirit in Black and White", 1994; caricature sketches of members of Beta Theta Pi, including Winstead “Doodles" Weaver, circa 1935; and Santa Fe Wing No. 9 by Nathan Oliveira, 1990.

Plan of the Leland Stanford Junior Univeristy, Palo Alto, California.

odd.p: Bird's eye rendering of Quad
Contents: 1 item is copy on mylar; 1 item is trimmed, encapsulated & on mount; 1 item is from ACCN 2008-135

did.unittitle: Plan for whole university differing from plan of Olmsted. Sketch shows two quads, the second east of the main quad with a central building similar to the 1919 library.

dao.title: Plan for whole university differing from plan of Olmsted

odd.head: General note
odd.p: in a mount

did.unittitle: Sunol
Electioneer by Rysdyk's Hambletonian, Dam Green Mountain Maid be Harry Clay. Property of Hon. Leland Stanford, Palo Alto Stock Farm.
Electioneer, 125. Sired by Rysdyk's Hambletonian. Owned by Leland Stanford. Palo Alto Stock Farm. Menlo Park, California.
Palo Alto, 5353 sired by Electioneer, 125. First Dam: Dame Winnie, Thoroughbred. Owned by Leland Stanford. Palo Alto Stock Farm. Menlo Park, California.
Assembly Hall. Suggestion for color. Plate 22. n.d.
Cactus Garden.
Robles Adobe. The house built by Secundido Robles.
Frenchman's Tower on Page Mill Road, an etching from an early photograph.
Escondito Cottage

The United States of America Panama-Pacific International Exposition, San Francisco, 1915. Celebrating the opening of the Panama Canal, the international jury of awards has conferred a silver medal upon Leland Stanford Junior University, Palo Alto, California, for pottery, in the Department of Education. Engraved and printed by the U.S. Bureau of Engraving and Printing.
Assembly, California Legislature, 1964 (first extraordinary) Session. Resolution relative to commending Dr. Wallace Sterling, President of Stanford University.
Palo Alto and the Leland Stanford Junior University. Probably from the San Francisco News Letter. Three views of the artist's conception of what the campus would look like when completed.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Jan 2006: matches top half of real estate promotion for Palo Alto put out by N. C. Carnall & Co. in 1888 [offered by Swann Galleries]

did.unittitle: Birds-eye view of Mayfield, Leland Stanford Jr. University and Palo Alto, the University Town. Published by Carnall-Fitzhugh-Hopkins Co. Lithograph by Dakin Publishing Co.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Reproduction added from accn 2008-194

did.unittitle: Leland Stanford Junior University Library and Assembly Hall. Percy and Hamilton Architects. Artist's conception of T. W. Stanford Library and assembly hall on Quad. Not as completed.
The Leland Stanford Junior University now in the course of completion. ..issued with the Christmas number, San Francisco News Letter, 1887. Lithhographed by Britton and Rey.
The Leland Stanford Junior University now in the course of completion. ..; Same as P016.1
The Leland Stanford Junior University now in the course of completion. ..; Same as P016.1 & P016.2
Stanford Stadium. Sketch from an air view of stadium looking toward quad. Text gives specifications of new stadium. Framed print: (94-170), 21 x 18 1/4 inches (image is 11 x 14 in.) at SAL.
Stanford University. Air view of campus by F. Standish, copyright 1930 by Stanley Milne.

Stanford University of the present and of the immediate future. From an airplane photograph, copyright 1922 by Burton Crandall. Verso contains a plan of the campus locating the existing and proposed buildings. Attached is a 5 page pamphlet which appears to be directed at raising funds.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: 1 copy of print only is encapsulated

did.unittitle: Stanford Scenes. No date, imprint, or further identification given. Color photographs of campus views. Contents: Hoover Tower, Memorial Church interior, Memorial Church exterior, Encina Hall & Hoover Tower, Memorial Church mosaics, Stanford Union, East Clock Tower, Memorial Hall, Physics Corner, West Gate Inner Quadrangle.
Frenchman's Tower on Page Mill Road, an etching by James Sanford from an early photograph. Includes copy of a Christmas card made from the same etching.

Stanford in Color. Ten views of Stanford in color. Photographed, lithographed, and published by Stanford University Press. Contents: Hoover Tower, Memorial Hall, University Library, Education Building, Stanford Union, East Clock Tower, Memorial Church, Archway to Memorial Court, Physics Corner, Museum. Descriptive pamphlet by Virginia L. Hobbs.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Contents: 3rd copy from accn 2000-309, no booklet; 4th copy from 2005-200; 5th and 6th copy from Accn 2017-089.

did.unittitle: Ray Lyman Wilbur, President, Stanford University, January 1, 1916 to January 1, 1942. Copy of a painting by Hubbell.

Lemos, Pedro J. Stanford etchings to Timothy Hopkins in appreciation. Contents: Stanford University Arch, "From the Foothills to the Bay," Memorial Court, The East Arch, Curving Roads at Stanford & Stanford Palms (same image). Also includes a short biography on Lemos and a letter of appreciation, "To Timothy Hopkins..."

odd.head: General note
odd.p: 5/2001 letter not in folder

did.unittitle: Lemos, Pedro J. Stanford Scenes. 4 original pieces, rest are printed pieces (mostly from publications).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: One original item is not signed.

did.unittitle: Stoll, John T.E. A portfolio of Stanford University, drawn and published by John T.E. Stoll. Contents: The new Stanford Union, th tower of the new eating hall, main entrance to the library, a wing of the new dormitory, the Memorial Church, the northwest entrance to Toyon, the basketball pavilion, a typical Stanford courtyard - Toyon Hall, Stanford's art gallery, interior of Toyon Hall, a Stanford Archway, an entrance to Toyon Hall.

The Leland Stanford Junior University; Plan of Central Premises, 1888, by Shepley, Rutan and Coolidge, architects, and Frederick Law and J. C. Olmsted, landscape architects. Includes: letter of tranmittal and copy, small note in envelope, and a note and a card recording contents (not necessarily accurate). In a large leather and satin book/ protective casing.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: see also Map 237 for mylar reproduction

controlaccess.subject: Campus Plan - 1888
Shepley, Rutan and Coolidge; Coolidge, Charles A.; Olmsted, J.C. & Frederick Law;

did.unittitle: Stern, Alec. Stanford Chapel.
Lites, Arthur. Inner Quad viewing east or west gate. Print of a watercolor.
Watercolors of Stanford Scenes reprinted from the Stanford Chapparal. Contents: the library, the farm, the Quad, the museum, and 2 copies of the west arch.
Sketches for Stanford Milestones. Presented to Stanford University by Mr. and Mrs. Arthrur P. Lites. Contents: Inner Quad, Memorial Church, Library, Toyon, Frost Amphitheater, School of Education.
"Warning! No shooting or trespassing allowed on these premises. The law will be strictly enforced. Jane L. Stanford."
Mrs. Stanford to the women of Stanford University, April 22, 1903. Caligraphy by W. R. Briggs, 1914, with illuminations. (Formerly framed and hung in the Women's Clubhouse.)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Missing - 4/95; found 06/2002

did.unittitle: Culver, Richard Keith. Miscellaneous drawings and papers. Contents: 2 copies "A College Calendar...;" 1 copy each of : self-portrait caricature, cartoon for Big Game 1895, cartoon of writer, and membership certificate for the Delta Upsilon Fraternity.

"Welcome to our Western Seat of Learning; no worthier lecturer has ever entered its walls." From the City Argus. Depicts Leland Stanford greeting former U.S. president Benjamin Harrison in front of the Quad

The doors thrown open. Drawn by Saalburg, printed by L. Schmidt & Lithograph Co. Under title Mr. Stanford is quoted as saying, "It is all for you my boy, and for the coming generations. My ambition is now satisfied. I have less desire to be president than to be the founder of an institution that will make presidents!"
California's best friend, drawn by H. Boyd, from the CIty Argus. Depicts Mr. Stanford shaking hands with Miss California, background shows Stanford's contributions to the state.
California's representative man, Hon. Leland Stanford. From the City Argus.
No title. Depicts an unidentified man offering the Presidential chair to Leland Stanford. [San Francisco] City Argus.
The Stanford Memorial Kindergartens. Frank Leslie's Illustrated Newspaper. Exterior and interior views of school no. 1.
Undergraduate library. Preliminary sketches of the floor plan of the undergraduate library by John Earle Warnecke and Associates.
Salviati and Company. Mosaic decoration in apse and above windows of Memorial Church, views of various mosaics created by Salviati and Company. Some signed by Jane L. Stanford.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Box 1 Watercolor paintings: 42.40 Watercolor in two panels: host of angels and angels with cross and crown of thorns. With Jane L. Stanford's approval on verso, 1900 42.41 Watercolor in two panels: angels with crown and host of angels 42.42 Watercolor of Christ's arrival in Heaven (with blank spaces for arches). Signed by A. Erm. Paoletti 42.43 Watercolor of Christ on throne in Heaven under rainbow (with blank spaces for arches). Signed by A. Erm. Paoletti 42.44 Three types of mosaic stone and when to use them, on black background board 42.45 Photograph of a mosaic, many panels including angels, Christ, cherubs, children with lamb. Signed note by Jane L. Stanford on verso, 1900 42.46 Watercolor of Adam and Eve in Garden with God. Signed by A. Erm. Paoletti 42.47 Watercolor of prophets under scene of Christ-child and Satan being cast out of Heaven. Signed by A. Erm. Paoletti 42.48 Two panels: young Mother Nature floating above clouds and young Father Time also floating. With Jane L. Stanford's approval on verso, 1901 42.49 Black and white watercolor of Christ and followers, front of Memorial Church 42.50 Mosaics over 4 arches: “alpha," “miracle of Moses," “harp of David," “omega," over Bible scenes 42.51 Mosaics over 4 arches: “peace," “religion," “mother's love," over virtues and Bible scenes 42.52 “Original color sketch for mosaic on front of Stanford Memorial Church" (color of 42.49)

Box 2 Prints and photographs: 42.1 Christ with halo and book 42.2 Christ crucified, carried by angels 42.3 Christ comforting afflicted 42.4 Christ visits “the widow" 42.5 Resurrection of Saint Lazarus 42.6 Christ crucified with emblems and evangelists 42.7 Father, Son, and Holy Ghost, worshipped by 2 angels 42.8 Pious IX grave 42.9 “Our Lord in Glory" 42.10 “Marriage of Our Lady" 42.11 “The Resurrection" 42.12 “Plafond of the Foyet of the Opera House" 42.13 Preacher saying mass under Christ and heavenly host (3 copies) 42.14 Mosaic of a woman's face - two different sizes of pieces (I and II ere Categorie A) 42.15 Mosaic of a woman's face - two different sizes of pieces (III and IV eme Categorie A) 42.16 Mosaic of a young Christ - two different sizes of pieces (I ere and II eme Categorie B) 42.17 Same as 42.16 with one side in color 42.18 Mosaic of young Christ (III eme Categorie B) and mosaic of detail (I ere Categorie) 42.19 Mosaic of Virgin Mary and different sizes of stones and when to use them 42.20 Woman with shall and purse, in flowered frame 42.21 Woman holding a jug with another on her head, in flowered frame 42.22 Woman in wrap standing by a fire 42.23 Resurrected Christ with eyes and hands upturned, in frame 42.24 Three scenes: plant life, boats with seagulls over them, and boats on a lake 42.25 Archer-woman wearing skirt and crushing grapes for wine, with dog 42.26 Woman with wrap bathing in waterfall under tree branch 42.27 Angel in robe 42.28 Christ with chalice 42.29 “Birth of Our Lord" 42.30 “Our Lord ascending into Heaven" 42.31 Maiden in flowing gown, carrying branches with blossoms and two doves 42.32 The last supper with Christ making sign of peace 42.33 Woman in shawl and head-covering, in flowered frame 42.34 Triangular picture of maiden, children, and animals in bower 42.35 Last supper with Christ breaking bread 42.36 Three panels: flowers, Christ with halo, and dark flowers under light flowers 42.37 Three panels: woman playing lute with two women reading, nude women dancing, and flowers 42.38 Three panels: berries, flowers, and leaves (pattern of four) 42.39 Woman with tambourine in flowered frame 42.53 Mosaic decoration in apse of the Leland Stanford Memorial Church Palo Alto California. Executed by Salviati and Co., Venice 1901. Photo mounted on linen. 42.54 Aurora di Guido Reni. Color print. “Approved for the outside of the Memorial Church at Stanford University. Rome Italy Dec. 18th 1900 Jane L. Stanford" 42.55 “Completion of the large picture on the front façade of Memorial Church. Accepted by Mrs. Stanford … July 27, 1904. Chas. Ed. Hodges, Archt." Black and white reproduction mounted on board with Salviati stamp. 42.55 Jacob's Dream 42.56 Moses charged to take Israel from Egypt 42.57 The blessing of Isaac 42.58 Joseph sold 42.59 Sacrifice of Abraham 42.60 Prophecy of the Prophets 42.61 Angel [one of the archangels] 42.62 Hymns of David 42.63 Glory of the Angels [celestial choir - figures facing right] 42.64 Glory of the Angels [celestial choir - figures facing left] 42.65 Jacob going to Canaan 42.66 Joshua, successor to Moses 42.67 Isaiah 42.68 Faith 42.69 Jeremiah [bears note and signature of Jane L. Stanford, Nov. 19, 1900] 42.70 Angel [bears note and signature of Jane L. Stanford, Nov. 19, 1900] 42.71 Elias [bears note and signature of Jane L. Stanford, Nov. 19, 1900] 42.72 David [bears note and signature of Jane L. Stanford, Nov. 19, 1900] 42.73 Angel [bears note and signature of Jane L. Stanford, Nov. 19, 1900] 42.74 - 42.88 Mosaics and designs used in other locations (London, Rome, New York, Berlin, Budapest) 42.89 - 42.98 Mosaics unidentified (Not used in Memorial Church)

did.unittitle: Peter Lassen's Bosquejo rancho patent signed by Abraham Lincoln. Includes a plot of the rancho's 22,000 acres. This rancho eventually became part of Leland Stanford's Vina Ranch.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: 3 framed ones found in 3sort when dept. moved back to Green West 5/99, not sure if these are represented above or are additional. They have been boxed separately.

did.unittitle: "At the Play" respectfully inscribed to the Wealth, Enterprise and Beauty of California by their faithful friend, Frederick Marriott. Supplement to the July 19, 1879 San Francisco Newsletter, reissued, August, 1883. Lithograph by Britton and Rey. Also, an article from the San Francisco Sunday Chronicle, April 9, 1961, describing the print, a black-and-white print of the lithograph, and a key to the lithograph.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Contents: Reprint from SF News Letter July 18, 1896 in B boxes ; Reprint from 1961 SF Chronicle in C boxes

Masonic Club of Stanford University. Charter signed by officers and 25 members.
Testimonial to Mrs. Stanford on the occasion of the laying of the cornerstone of the Gymnasium, with signatures of student body.
Stanford University war service record. "Tabulations be classes showing number in Army, Marines, & Navy segregated according to grade."
Certificate of distinction . . . awarded by the War Department to Stanford University for the training of soldiers in the Army Specialized Training Program during World War II.

did.unittitle: Associated Students Stanford University. This is to Certify that Ralph I. McFadden has been awarded the Stanford Block S in football for the season of '00-'01-'02 [i.e. 1900-1902]. Signed by Paul McCloskey and Arthur E. Worthy

odd.head: General note
odd.p: stained and discolored

did.unittitle: To the Resigning Chairman of English [Ian Watt] May 1971. Poem, hand-written; signed below (first names only). Also includes note on presentation of the scroll, [Tom's speech: 5/30/1971]
Posters and illustrations [1 item in map case]

Christmas cards with Memorial Church images, both with envelopes (originally sent to Pauline Gartzman)

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Contents: P327.1 Season's Greetings - image inside; P327.2 Stanford Memorial Church image on outside

did.unittitle: Varian Looks at Radar through the Ages. Series of advertisements with cartoons by C. E. B. Bernard. Text is handwritten but unsure if it's original or printed.

Envelope with images & text re Palo Alto. Images: SU inner quad and University Avenue in PA. Text: Palo Alto seat of Stanford University. 30 miles S. of San Francisco / Population 7000 [and cost of utilities and taxes]

odd.head: General note
odd.p: From W. Hammon (gift? purchase?) in the 1980s; no accn number noted.

did.unittitle: The Gold Spike. The spike commemorates the joining of the Central Pacific and Union Pacific Railways at Promontory, Utah, on May 10, 1869. Stanford University Museum of Art; Printed by H. S. Crocker co. for the Committee for Art at Stanford; [photo of Gold Spike on red velvet on front, text on back]

odd.p: could be a postcard but lacks typical markings on non-image side

did.unittitle: Front view of quad, pre-1905, from either Chemistry or Museum roof. Hand-colored.

View of Quad Corner (Engineering?) (pre-1905). Hand-colored.
View of East Gates of Quad (pre-1905). Hand-colored.

Entrance to old Stanford Home and University Grounds, adjoining entrance to Stanford Park, Cal. Specimen print in Sepia Duotone from the press of the Associated Priting Co., San Francisco. [Based on Frank Davey photograph]
Palo Alto, 5353 sired by Electioneer, 125. First Dam: Dame Winnie, Thoroughbred. Owned by Leland Stanford. Palo Alto Stock Farm. Menlo Park, California. [copy 3]
"Home Sweet Home, #I." Depicts "Frossotti Beer Garden," by P.A. Mooney. Print numbered 1 of 30.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Image of Rossotti's, or "Zott's," in Portola Valley. Rossotti's is now known as the Alpine Inn.
